html: Dual meanings of the name Ariel—“Altar Hearth” and “Lion of God”—allude to the dual destinies of Jehovah’s people whom it symbolizes. The “city” that represents his people divides in two: one part turns to wickedness and suffers a Sodom-and-Gomorrah type of destruction; the other turns to righteousness and enjoys deliverance at the intercession of Jehovah’s servant David ( Isaiah 1:21, 26-27; 25:1-2; 26:1-6; 37:20, 35; 55:3-4). In spite of his people’s observing annual feastdays and solemn occasions, and of his servant’s having dwelt among them, Jehovah’s curse on Ariel attests to their apostasy.
